15// DESCRIPTION:
16// Zone Memory Allocation, perhaps NeXT ObjectiveC inspired.
17// Remark: this was the only stuff that, according
18// to John Carmack, might have been useful for
19// Quake.

23#ifndef __Z_ZONE__
24#define __Z_ZONE__
25
26#include <stdio.h>
27
28//
29// ZONE MEMORY
30// PU - purge tags.
31
32enum
33{
34 PU_STATIC = 1, // static entire execution time
35 PU_SOUND, // static while playing
36 PU_MUSIC, // static while playing
37 PU_FREE, // a free block
38 PU_LEVEL, // static until level exited
39 PU_LEVSPEC, // a special thinker in a level
40
41 // Tags >= PU_PURGELEVEL are purgable whenever needed.
42
43 PU_PURGELEVEL,
44 PU_CACHE,
45
46 // Total number of different tag types
47
48 PU_NUM_TAGS
49};
50
51
52void Z_Init(void);
53void *Z_Malloc(int size, int tag, void *ptr);
54void Z_Free(void *ptr);
55void Z_FreeTags(int lowtag, int hightag);
56void Z_DumpHeap(int lowtag, int hightag);
57void Z_FileDumpHeap(FILE *f);
58void Z_CheckHeap(void);
59void Z_ChangeTag2(void *ptr, int tag, const char *file, int line);
60void Z_ChangeUser(void *ptr, void **user);
61int Z_FreeMemory(void);
62unsigned int Z_ZoneSize(void);
63
64//
65// This is used to get the local FILE:LINE info from CPP
66// prior to really call the function in question.
67//
68#define Z_ChangeTag(p, t) Z_ChangeTag2((p), (t), __FILE__, __LINE__)
69
70
71#endif
